messages: 0656b523eeb14eee8871bc9d2359fdf0 (14:58): Is it a way to launch a :make command in background ?
cdbd8fab257a057480813b01e4aa2779 (15:21): yo uebayashisan
f9c8f5d915ec27ed1bacf25fe8db6f0d (15:32): i was in here earlier asking how to paste without getting the wierd effects. I still cant figure it out
f9c8f5d915ec27ed1bacf25fe8db6f0d (15:32): using putty so I dont knwo if that matters
f9c8f5d915ec27ed1bacf25fe8db6f0d (15:33): i dont understand hwo to put it in paste mode
dd7ebb57f2229b973af8b73142f3e7fd (15:35): if your pasting in a putty window, enter insert mode then right click
f9c8f5d915ec27ed1bacf25fe8db6f0d (15:35): ya... for some reason it puts a shit load of tabs and // comments
f9c8f5d915ec27ed1bacf25fe8db6f0d (15:36): does it automatically which is wierd
dd7ebb57f2229b973af8b73142f3e7fd (15:36): hmm, do u have an ESC sequence in what you are pasting?
f9c8f5d915ec27ed1bacf25fe8db6f0d (15:37): i dont know... its just some php
f9c8f5d915ec27ed1bacf25fe8db6f0d (15:37): shouldnt be any escape sequences
dd7ebb57f2229b973af8b73142f3e7fd (15:37): no weird chars?
f9c8f5d915ec27ed1bacf25fe8db6f0d (15:37): nope
f9c8f5d915ec27ed1bacf25fe8db6f0d (15:37): i am copying it out of a vim window though
f9c8f5d915ec27ed1bacf25fe8db6f0d (15:37): a putty window
f9c8f5d915ec27ed1bacf25fe8db6f0d (15:37): that might cause it?
dd7ebb57f2229b973af8b73142f3e7fd (15:38): do u have listchars or anything like that? how does it look when u paste into a simple txt editor (notepad/wordpad)
f9c8f5d915ec27ed1bacf25fe8db6f0d (15:38): looks completely normal in notepad
f9c8f5d915ec27ed1bacf25fe8db6f0d (15:39): definetly vim adding the comments
dd7ebb57f2229b973af8b73142f3e7fd (15:56): back
dd7ebb57f2229b973af8b73142f3e7fd (15:57): d03boy: try turning the comments feature off :he comments
f9c8f5d915ec27ed1bacf25fe8db6f0d (15:58): i dont kow how to turn this stuff off
dd7ebb57f2229b973af8b73142f3e7fd (16:00): :he formatoptions might help
dd7ebb57f2229b973af8b73142f3e7fd (16:01): try a :set formatoptions? if it has a c in the flag list then comment formating is on
cdbd8fab257a057480813b01e4aa2779 (16:09): d03boy: :set paste
cdbd8fab257a057480813b01e4aa2779 (16:10): Enter insert mode
cdbd8fab257a057480813b01e4aa2779 (16:10): Right click your stuff
f9c8f5d915ec27ed1bacf25fe8db6f0d (16:10): excelelnt
f9c8f5d915ec27ed1bacf25fe8db6f0d (16:10): i wasnt sure how to set :)

fc8aebd9de0aa43521658b45805c1d74 (16:11): hello.  I was wondering if there's a way  to restrict the scope of the "ab" command.  I'd like some abreviations to be active only when editing HTML :(  Is this somehow possible?
f9eab7a52fbda6f4788f438ba1a8da94 (16:13): spielmann: ftplugins
fc8aebd9de0aa43521658b45805c1d74 (16:14): ahhh thanks!
fc8aebd9de0aa43521658b45805c1d74 (16:15): and does anybody know if there's a nice xml plugin for ViM that can automatically enter whole element blocks?  I've tried XML.vim  but it won't quite do it
0656b523eeb14eee8871bc9d2359fdf0 (16:20): Is it a way to launch a :make command in background ?
ae18edf15ee4c351eed3e0da15a769a0 (16:20): elshaa, !make& ?
ae18edf15ee4c351eed3e0da15a769a0 (16:21): :set makeprg=make& ?
ae18edf15ee4c351eed3e0da15a769a0 (16:21): not sure, but I imagine this should work..
0656b523eeb14eee8871bc9d2359fdf0 (16:22): hum, right. Thanks
0656b523eeb14eee8871bc9d2359fdf0 (16:27): hum, the :set makeprg=make& command does not really works. It makes :make behave weird. Let's find something else.
